Scotland JS

May 2015

Watch the 2013 video Close video

Timeline

In preperation for ScotlandJS we thought you might be interested in an insight into what goes on behind the scenes. Below is a rough timeline of what has been going on.

20/11/2013: Booked venue: Our Dynamic Earth.

7/1/2014: New site live - thanks Daniel Grieve!

7/1/2014: Open CFP.

Promote CFP, locally and internationally.

7/1/2014: Approach Callbackwomen and DevChix to make our event more visible to a more diverse speaking pool.

8/1/2014: Contacted Timebase.tv to record speaker sessions.

15/1/2014: Jen Myres kindly offered to mentor newbie female speakers. Thanks Jen!

20/1/2014: TestDouble offer to put on 'Real-world JavaScript Testing' workshop as this years Charity Tutorial Day.

31/1/2014: Video chat session for potential speakers to ask questions about the event.

3/2/2014: Video chat session for potential speakers to ask questions about the event.

1/2/2014: Approach Keynotes.

Lack of talk submissions from local JS folks! Began awareness effort at local user groups and online.

3/2/2014: Release early bird and full price tickets.

8/2/2014: Approached Amanda O'Connell, from Minds Matter Training, about helping us improve Mental Health awareness within the tech community.

10/2/2014: Release student tickets.

12/2/2014: Close CFP.

15/2/2014: Voting begins by ticket holders.

24/2/2014: Inform speakers of acceptance.

3/3/2014: Announce line up.

4/3/2014: Booked venue for Charity Tutorial.

25/3/2014: Discussion Track Announced in detail.

25/3/2014 Inform speakers of projector resolution and layout template.

10/4/2014 Announce sponsors.

11/4/2014: Mark Boas drops out. Dave Kennedy steps to replace.

22/4/2014: Inform speakers of hash tags for Discussion Track.
